articles.headline: Awash in Empty Homes, China Asks Migrant Workers to Settle Down
articles.snippet: Beijing hopes to turns the country’s hundreds of millions of itinerant laborers into homeowners as the slumping property market drags on the economy.
articles.abstract: Beijing hopes to turns the country’s hundreds of millions of itinerant laborers into homeowners as the slumping property market drags on the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Migrant workers are the unsung heroes of China’s economic miracle. Numbering more than 270 million, they abandon their impoverished farms and villages to move to the cities, where they run the factories and build the highways and high-rises that have made China’s growth the envy of the world.

articles.headline: Head of VW’s U.S. Unit Is Out, and Dealers Are Alarmed
articles.snippet: Michael Horn has played a crucial role in rebuilding Volkswagen’s relationship with its dealership network, gaining the support of the sales force.
articles.abstract: Michael Horn has played a crucial role in rebuilding Volkswagen’s relationship with its dealership network, gaining the support of the sales force.
articles.lead_paragraph: The head of Volkswagen’s American operations, a central figure in the carmaker’s effort to repair relations with dealers and customers after an emissions scandal, unexpectedly stepped down on Wednesday.

articles.headline: How George Martin Changed Pop Music Production
articles.snippet: Notable producers discuss Mr. Martin, who helped define a pop music producer’s role as equal parts technical master and creative enabler.
articles.abstract: Notable producers discuss Mr. Martin, who helped define a pop music producer’s role as equal parts technical master and creative enabler.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the legions of musicians, producers and music executives who carefully followed everything the Beatles did, one name on the band’s records mattered perhaps just as much as those of the Fab Four themselves: George Martin.

articles.headline: Mutual Funds Oppose S.E.C.’s Plan for a Bigger Cash Cushion
articles.snippet: David W. Grim, who leads the agency’s asset management division, is pushing to increase funds’ liquidity cushions so investors can sell out quickly.
articles.abstract: David W. Grim, who leads the agency’s asset management division, is pushing to increase funds’ liquidity cushions so investors can sell out quickly.
articles.lead_paragraph: At an industry conference last week, the lead regulator for the Securities and Exchange Commission’s asset management division came under fire.

articles.headline: Gawker Editor’s Testimony Stuns Courtroom in Hulk Hogan Trial
articles.snippet: Albert J. Daulerio suggested in a deposition that celebrity sex tapes featuring children over 4 could be newsworthy. Gawker later said his comment was sarcastic.
articles.abstract: Albert J. Daulerio suggested in a deposition that celebrity sex tapes featuring children over 4 could be newsworthy. Gawker later said his comment was sarcastic.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. — A palpable sense of shock rippled through a courtroom here Wednesday morning when the former editor in chief of Gawker.com was shown in a videotaped deposition suggesting that almost anything goes when it comes to the newsworthiness of celebrities’ sex videos.

articles.headline: After Michigan Loss, Hillary Clinton Sharpens Message on Jobs and Trade
articles.snippet: Bernie Sanders’s surprising victory came after he contended that he was the only candidate who had opposed free trade agreements that led to U.S. job losses.
articles.abstract: Bernie Sanders’s surprising victory came after he contended that he was the only candidate who had opposed free trade agreements that led to U.S. job losses.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — From the start of her presidential campaign 11 months ago, Hillary Clinton has presented an upbeat assessment of an improving economy, saying Wall Street and corporations would be held accountable, but must be part of the solution for all Americans to benefit from the country’s prosperity.

articles.headline: In Democratic Debate, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Clash on Immigration
articles.snippet: Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Sanders attacked each other’s records and argued over who would better represent Hispanic voters’ interests.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Sanders attacked each other’s records and argued over who would better represent Hispanic voters’ interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: Join us for live updates of the Republican debate.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Amy Chozick

articles.headline: Christians Flock to Groups That Help Members Pay Medical Bills
articles.snippet: Interest in health care sharing ministries has grown among people who want to follow their religious beliefs, save money and not be forced to buy insurance.
articles.abstract: Interest in health care sharing ministries has grown among people who want to follow their religious beliefs, save money and not be forced to buy insurance.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO — When Chris Doyle learned that his health insurance deductible would climb to $10,000 last year, he and his wife, both evangelical Christians, “spent a couple weeks just praying,” he said.
